ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: To enable touchscreen functionality on a MacBook using its existing webcam and a simple hardware modification.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Transforms MacBook into a touchscreen â€¢ Uses built-in webcam â€¢ Requires minimal hardware ($1) â€¢ Utilizes computer vision for touch detection â€¢ Proof-of-concept demonstration
ðŸ“– Summary: Project Sistine transforms a MacBook into a touchscreen by using its built-in webcam and a small mirror to detect finger proximity and touches on the screen. It leverages computer vision techniques to translate the video feed into usable touch input, requiring minimal hardware.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ’¡ Migrate-OSS | Kotlin
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Mobile data backup and restoration for Android devices.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Backup and restore call log history â€¢ Backup and restore SMS messages â€¢ Backup and restore contacts â€¢ Planned features include calendar entries backup, password protection, and root-based app/system feature backup
ðŸ“– Summary: Migrate-OSS is an Android application designed for backing up and restoring essential user data, including call logs, SMS messages, and contacts. It aims to provide a reliable way for users to safeguard their personal information and transfer it between devices or after system resets.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ”¥ RadioPlayerV3 | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Streaming music and radio content into Telegram group/channel voice chats.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Playlist with queuing and 24/7 radio support â€¢ YouTube Live stream support â€¢ Auto-fallback to radio when playlist ends â€¢ Persistent playback even after restarts â€¢ Show current audio playback position
ðŸ“– Summary: RadioPlayerV3 is an advanced Python-based Telegram bot designed to stream music and radio directly into group or channel voice chats. It supports playlists, 24/7 radio streaming, YouTube Live, and offers features like persistent playback and interactive controls.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ”¥ gitlogue | Rust
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Visualizing and replaying Git commit history in a cinematic, animated format within the terminal.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Commit Replay as Animation â€¢ Working Tree Diff View â€¢ Tree-sitter Syntax Highlighting â€¢ Project File Tree â€¢ Screensaver Mode
ðŸ“– Summary: gitlogue is a terminal-based tool that transforms your Git commit history into a cinematic, animated replay. It visualizes code changes with realistic typing animations, syntax highlighting, and file tree transitions, making code evolution a visual experience.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸš€ CyberScraper-2077 | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Automated and intelligent web data extraction using AI and LLMs.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ AI-Powered Extraction â€¢ Streamlit Interface â€¢ Multi-Format Support (JSON, CSV, HTML, SQL, Excel) â€¢ Tor Network Support â€¢ Stealth Mode
ðŸ“– Summary: CyberScraper 2077 is an AI-powered web scraping tool that leverages LLMs like OpenAI, Gemini, and Ollama to extract data from the internet with high precision. It offers both a traditional scraping branch with advanced features and an enterprise-grade integration with the Scrapeless SDK.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸŒŸ dexter | TypeScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Performing deep, autonomous financial research and analysis to answer complex financial queries.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Intelligent Task Planning â€¢ Autonomous Execution â€¢ Self-Validation â€¢ Real-Time Financial Data Access â€¢ Safety Features (loop detection, step limits)
ðŸ“– Summary: Dexter is an autonomous financial research agent built with TypeScript that leverages task planning, self-reflection, and real-time market data to answer complex financial questions. It breaks down queries, executes research using various tools, validates its findings, and synthesizes data-backed answers.
